messageDigest.description: Message digest can be used to identify the artifact. Clients MUST NOT attempt to use this digest to verify the associated signature; it is intended solely for identification.

signature.description: The raw bytes as returned from the signature algorithm. The signature algorithm (and so the format of the signature bytes) are determined by the contents of the 'verification_material', either a key-pair or a certificate. If using a certificate, the certificate contains the required information on the signature algorithm. When using a key pair, the algorithm MUST be part of the public key, which MUST be communicated out-of-band.

MessageSignature.title: Message Signature
MessageSignature.description: MessageSignature stores the computed signature over a message.

algorithm.title:
This package defines commonly used message types within the Sigstore
 community.
algorithm.description: This package defines commonly used message types within the Sigstore community.  Only a subset of the secure hash standard algorithms are supported. See <https://nvlpubs.nist.gov/nistpubs/FIPS/NIST.FIPS.180-4.pdf> for more details. UNSPECIFIED SHOULD not be used, primary reason for inclusion is to force any proto JSON serialization to emit the used hash algorithm, as default option is to *omit* the default value of an enum (which is the first value, represented by '0'.

digest.description: This is the raw octets of the message digest as computed by the hash algorithm.

dev.sigstore.common.v1.HashOutput.title: Hash Output
dev.sigstore.common.v1.HashOutput.description: HashOutput captures a digest of a 'message' (generic octet sequence) and the corresponding hash algorithm used.
